*div1 type="summary"* *p*John A. Williams to Austin, July 19, 1826. Maladministration of government in east Texas.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Texas Aysh Bayou*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="07-19-1826">19th July 1826*/date_mentioned*.*/p* *p**person_mentioned*Conl Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Sir Although I have not the pleasure of your acquaintence, yet I hope you will take no exceptions at my attempting to hold corrispondence with you, on a subject, which I deem important to every *person_mentioned*emigrant */person_mentioned**location_mentioned*in this section of country*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*The peculiar manner in which business has been transacted, for some time, in this *location_mentioned*settlement*/location_mentioned*, and also at *location_mentioned*Nacogdoches */location_mentioned*has, by no means been satisfactory. Charges against *person_mentioned*individuals */person_mentioned*for immaginary crimes hitherto unheard of in a free *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*. Threats of banishment against several of the best and most worthy *person_mentioned*farmers */person_mentioned*in the *location_mentioned*District of Nacogdoches*/location_mentioned* who happen unfortunately to be, not of the *person_mentioned*ruling party*/person_mentioned*. These are the rewards we receive for leaving our *location_mentioned*native country */location_mentioned*and coming to participate in the liberties of *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p*The other day one *person_mentioned*James Williams*/person_mentioned*, while in a state of intoxication, made use of some ungarded expresions to the *person_mentioned*constable Johnson*/person_mentioned*. He, *person_mentioned*Williams */person_mentioned*was arrested, brought up before the *person_mentioned*Alcalde, Sprowl*/person_mentioned*, prosecuted, tried, and convicted, for speaking inflametory words against the *person_mentioned*government*/person_mentioned*, and has since, as I am informed, received sentence of banishment*/p*.
*p*I have good reasons to believe that depositions have lately been taken against me for charges of simmiler nature. It is said by my *person_mentioned*enemies */person_mentioned*that these depositions, has been, or shortly will be, forwarded on [to] the *location_mentioned*seat of government*/location_mentioned*, and that I am to have a secret trial.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*James Gaines*/person_mentioned* is believed to be the prime mover of all these questionable measures. Who, if suffered to pursue with impunity, the course which he has adopted, must ultimately, render the *person_mentioned*Americans*/person_mentioned* in this section of *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*odious to the *location_mentioned*Mexican nation*/location_mentioned*, considerably retard the progress of emigration and in the end produce consequences the most dangerous to *person_mentioned*society */person_mentioned*The *person_mentioned*people */person_mentioned*are compleetly in a ferment, and what will be the consequences I am unable to say. But this much I will venture to predict. Anull arbutary power, and tranquilety will be restored, It is said that *person_mentioned*James Gains*/person_mentioned* has threatened to emancipate all *person_mentioned*Elisha Roberts*/person_mentioned*' *person_mentioned*negroes*/person_mentioned*, (about 30 in number) These are only reports, I know not as to the truth of it. but it has its effect in acting to the general confusion, and exciting the suspicions of credulous man.*/p*
*p*The people are willing and ancious to obey the law properly administered. But it is mortifying to the feeling of an *person_mentioned*American */person_mentioned*to stoop to arbetary sway. I atribute none of our present difficulties to any person but *person_mentioned*James Gaines*/person_mentioned* and his *person_mentioned*understrapers*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I hope sir that you will have the goodness to inquire into our condition, minutely; and make such statements to the proper authority or take such other measures as you may deem most expedient to restore tranquilety, and afford us that protection of person, property, and civil rights, which the *location_mentioned*Mexican Nation*/location_mentioned* has promised to the *person_mentioned*strangers */person_mentioned*who come and settle in her *location_mentioned*teritories*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Jno A Williams*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*/div1*
